skill.name: skill-creator
skill.description: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill (or update an existing skill) that extends Claude's capabilities with specialized knowledge, workflows, or tool integrations.
skill.summary: Guide for creating effective skills. This skill should be used when users want to create a new skill...
skill.author: BOM-98

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code, network access, or file system modifications. Contains only guidance for creating skills. Referenced scripts (init_skill.py, package_skill.py) are NOT present in the skill directory.

content.value_statement: Creating skills from scratch is time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides a structured 6-step process to design, build, and package skills with proven patterns for modular, reusable capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Define skill anatomy with SKILL.md and bundled resources
Apply progressive disclosure for efficient context management
Package skills into distributable zip files
Organize scripts, references, and assets for reusability
limitations: Does not execute code or create files automatically
Requires user to implement scripts and references
No validation or testing capabilities included

use_cases.title: Build Custom Skills
use_cases.description: Create specialized skills for your domain with scripts, references, and assets organized for reuse.

use_cases.title: Standardize Skill Templates
use_cases.description: Establish consistent skill structure across your team with packaging and validation workflows.

use_cases.title: Package and Distribute
use_cases.description: Package skills into distributable zip files with validation and proper directory structure.

prompt_templates.title: Create New Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new skill called [skill-name] for [use-case]. Follow the skill creation process to plan reusable resources.

prompt_templates.title: Structure Existing Skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my existing skill and suggest improvements for structure, progressive disclosure, and bundled resources.

prompt_templates.title: Package for Distribution
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through packaging my skill for distribution. What validation does the packaging script perform?

prompt_templates.title: Design Best Practices
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the progressive disclosure design principle and how to apply it when structuring a skill's SKILL.md and resources.

output_examples.input: Help me create a PDF editing skill
output: 3. Structure SKILL.md: Keep it under 200 lines, reference detailed docs

best_practices: Keep SKILL.md under 200 lines by moving detailed content to references/
Use scripts/ for deterministic, reusable code that is executed repeatedly
Apply progressive disclosure: metadata triggers skill, body provides context, references load as needed
anti_patterns: Putting all documentation in SKILL.md without using references/ folder
Including scripts that are only run once or never reused
Failing to validate skill structure before packaging for distribution

faq.question: What tools support skills created with this skill?
faq.answer: Skills are compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. They provide specialized knowledge and workflows for any Claude instance.

faq.question: What is the maximum size for a skill?
faq.answer: SKILL.md must be under 200 lines. Reference files and scripts should also follow progressive disclosure to manage context efficiently.

faq.question: How do skills integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Skills are activated based on metadata (name, description). Claude loads SKILL.md body when triggered, then references files as needed.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using skills?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only contains documentation. It does not access files, networks, or execute code. Skills run in isolated context.

faq.question: Why is my skill not being triggered?
faq.answer: Check skill metadata: name and description must match the task. Skills activate when Claude determines they are relevant to the current work.

faq.question: How is this skill different from other skill templates?
faq.answer: This skill provides the process and best practices for creating ANY skill. It focuses on progressive disclosure, resource organization, and packaging.
